name: v3.3.2
body: * Don't strip trailing new lines from files. Fixes [#451](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/451), PR [#452](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/452).

name: v3.3.1
body: * Fix for setting deploy key in some cases fail with HTTP 400: `{"fingerprint":["has already been taken"]}`. Fixes [#19](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/19), PR [#441](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/441).

name: 3.4.0rc1
body:
* **Add support for [multiple merge request approval rules](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/merge_requests/approvals/rules.html#add-multiple-approval-rules) and for changing the name of the currently managed single approval rule**. Implements [#388](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/388) and [#95](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/95), PR [#435](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/435). The syntax for this feature is shown [here](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/388#issuecomment-1278213194) for now - it will be moved to the GitHub Pages docs before the final release of v3.4.0.
* (For contributors) Big refactoring to make the code more logically groupped and contribution documentation updates for easier contributions. Please see the commit messages in the PR [#431](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/431) for more information.

name: v3.3.0
body:
* **Add support for managing project [Protected environments](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/environments/protected_environments.html#protected-environments).** PR [#423](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/423) & PR [#430](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/430)
* Add support for Python 3.11 and switch to this version in the Docker image.
* (For contributors) Move all the GitLabForm tests that require GitLab Premium license into a separate module and introduce a new GitHub Actions flow to enable running them for PRs after the maintainer's approval.

Thanks to [Rafael Zanella](https://github.com/zanella) for his contributions!

name: v3.3.0rc3
body:
## 3.3.0rc3

Exactly like 3.3.0rc2 which was not released to PyPI because of a GitHub Actions configuration issue in this repo.

## 3.3.0rc2

Like 3.3.0rc1 + improvement to the Protected environments syntax and a fix for the Python 3.11 Docker image (it used an RC2 version of Python 3.11 instead of its final one). 

Thanks to [Rafael Zanella](https://github.com/zanella) for his contribution!

name: v3.3.0rc1
body:
* **Add support for managing project [Protected environments](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/environments/protected_environments.html#protected-environments).** PR [#423](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/423).
* Add support for Python 3.11 and switch to this version in the Docker image.
* (For contributors) Move all the GitLabForm tests that require GitLab Premium license into a separate module and introduce a new GitHub Actions flow to enable running them for PRs after the maintainer's approval.

Thanks to [Rafael Zanella](https://github.com/zanella) for his contribution!

name: v3.2.0
body: * **Add authoritative mode (`enforce: true`) support to group badges, group LDAP links, group variables, badges, deploy keys, variables.** Implements [#403](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/403), PR [#419](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/419).

name: v3.1.2
body: * Make setting project-level CI/CI variables with a non-default different `environment_scope` work again. Fixes [#411](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/411), PR [#414](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/414).

name: v3.1.1
body: * Fixed error when passing the GitLab token in the config file with single or double quotes. Fixes [#401](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/401), PR [#412](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/412).

name: v3.1.0
body:
* **Add support for Resource groups**. Implements [#341](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/341). PR [#369](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/369).
* Fix Integrations documentation. PR [#402](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/402).  

Thanks to [@ep-linden](https://github.com/ep-linden) from [Elastic Path](https://www.elasticpath.com/) and to [@L154x](https://github.com/L154x) for their contribution!

name: v3.0.0
body:
This is a major new version with some backward incompatibility. Please follow [the upgrade guide](https://gitlabform.github.io/gitlabform/upgrade/) for a fast and safe upgrade.

New features/bugfixes:

* **Subgroups now _do_ inherit the settings from their groups.** It should have worked like this already, but it did not because of a [bug #372](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/372) fixed in [PR #385](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/pull/385). (Please use `inherit: false` to keep the old behavior. See [the upgrade guide](https://gitlabform.github.io/gitlabform/upgrade/) for more info.),
* **Shorter and easier to read errors** (full stacktrace shown only when `--debug` is enabled),

Backward-incompatible maintenance changes:

* **Require GitLab version >= 14.4** (released in Oct 2021) as it contains the [required API rename](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/334500),
* **Require Python version >= 3.7** (as 3.6 is EOL since Dec 2021) and update many dependencies that have required it,
* **Drop support for a lot of deprecated configuration syntax** that the app has warned about: 
    * branch protection - no more `developers_can_push`, `developers_can_merge`, use `push_access_level`, `merge_access_level` etc. instead,
    * group members - no more `group_shared_with`, `enforce_group_members`, `group_access_level`, use `group_members`, `group_members.enforce`, `group_access` instead,
    * services/integrations - no more `recreate`,
* **Rename some configuration sections** following the renames made in GitLab:
    * `services` -> `integrations`,
    * `secret_variables` -> `variables`,
    * `group_secret_variables` -> `group_variables`,
* Drop the Debian-based Docker image (it's practically unused - you can maintain your own, if you needed it),
* _(For users of this app as a library)_ Rename some API methods, remove deprecated ones:
    * `protect_branch()` is now the method using the new API, the method using the old one has been removed,
    * `branch_code_owner_approval_required()` -> `set_branch_code_owner_approval_required()`.
    * `delete_legacy_approvers()` has been removed,
    * all the methods with `service(s)`/`secret_variable(s)`/`group_secret_variable(s)` in their names have been renamed to contain `integration(s)`/`variable(s)`/`group_variables(s)`.

Thanks to the contributors of this release: [@ep-linden](https://github.com/ep-linden) from [Elastic Path](https://www.elasticpath.com/).

name: v2.12.0
body:
* Update base Docker images:
  * from Python 3.9 and Alpine 3.14 to Python 3.10 and Alpine 3.16,
  * from Python 3.9 and Debian 10 (Buster) to Python 3.10 and Debian 11 (Bullseye).
* Fix Group CI/CD Variables not honoring `protected` and `masked` values set to `false`. Fixes [#384](https://github.com/gitlabform/gitlabform/issues/384).

name: v2.11.1post3
body: * Moved the project from `gdubicki/gitlabform` to `gitlabform/gitlabform`. Stopped publishing new images to the old `egnyte/gitlabform` Docker registry.

name: v2.11.1
body: Fix another case of GitLab's Schedules API change/bug. Really fixes https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/364.

name: v2.11.0
body:
* **Allow breaking configuration inheritance**. Implements [#326](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/326). PR [#339](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/pull/339). Imagine you have a configuration like this: ```yaml projects_and_groups: my-group/*: members: enforce: true groups: regular-developers: group_access: developer my-group/special-private-project: members: inherit: false # <--- the new keyword enforce: true groups: special-developers: group_access: developer users: john: access_level: maintainer ``` With the new `inherit: false` entry used here, the effective members for `my-group/special-private-project` project are ONLY the `special-developers` grup and `john` user. * Always expect pagination for GETs. Fixes [#354](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/354). PR [#358](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/pull/358). * Workaround for the GitLab's Schedules API change/bug. Fixes [#361](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/361).
Big thanks to the [Elastic Path](https://www.elasticpath.com/) team for their contribution of the above feature, especially [@ep-linden](https://github.com/ep-linden) for the whole implementation and [@amimas](https://github.com/amimas) for the initial proposal and cooperation on design!
(There were 4 pre-releases of this version, 2.11.0b1-b4. b1 contained "Allow breaking configuration inheritance", b2 also [#358](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/pull/358), b3 also a fix of a bug that caused breaking config inheritance to not work in some cases, b4 - [#361](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/361)).

name: v2.11.0b4
body: The same as the final v2.11.0.

name: v2.11.0b3
body: Like v2.11.0b4 but without [#361](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/361).

name: v2.11.0b2
body: Like v2.11.0b3 but without fix o a bug that caused breaking config inheritance to not work in some cases.

name: v2.11.0b1
body: Like v2.11.0b2 but without [#358](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/pull/358).

name: v2.10.1
body: * Fix a problem causing some changes to not be applied. Fixes [#334](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/334). PR [#350](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/pull/350).

name: v2.10.1rc1
body: * Fix a problem causing some changes to not be applied. Fixes [#334](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/334). PR [#350](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/pull/350).

name: v2.10.0
body:
* **Deleting deploy keys is now possible**. This partially implements [#193](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/193). Also completely replace the implementation of deploy keys, secret variables and group secret variables with a new universal one. This possibly fixes [#19](https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/issues/19).
* **Up to 40% faster thanks to making less requests to GitLab.** (For almost 1000 repositories the apply time has dropped from ~18 minutes to ~11 minutes.)
* With debug enabled a lot less duplication and a more readable output of dicts (shown as JSONs).
* **For Contributors** Introduce `SingleEntityProcessor` that generalizes editing things that are single per project, f.e. settings or push rules set. It does not edit entities if there are no changes to be applied. Using it implementing new features can be superfast! (See also `MultipleEntitiesProcessor` added in v2.2.0).
* **For Contributors** Faster tests and improved usage of fixtures.

(A pre-release of 2.9.2 RC1 contained some of the above changes. 2.10.0rc1 pre-release was the same as 2.10.0 final but with a slightly different changelog - the speed gains turned out to be higher than expected.)

name: v2.10.0rc1
body: See https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/releases/tag/v2.10.0.

name: v2.9.2rc1
body: See https://github.com/gdubicki/gitlabform/releases/tag/v2.10.0.

name: v2.9.1
body: * Fix version 2.9.0 not even starting. 🤦‍♂️ Add test to prevent this from happening again.

name: v2.9.0
body:
* **Access level names (not only their numbers) are now accepted in the configuration**.
* More strictness in parsing configuration YAML and better error messages thanks to a switch to different libraries. F.e. hash keys overwriting is not accepted anymore.
* Moved the project from `egnyte/gitlabform` to `gdubicki/gitlabform` and switch to GitHub Registry as the new main Docker registry.

name: v2.9.0a1
body:
* **Access level names (not only their numbers) are now accepted in the configuration**.
* More strictness in parsing configuration YAML and better error messages thanks to a switch to different libraries. F.e. hash keys overwriting is not accepted anymore.

name: v2.8.1
body: * Don't show "Warning: Using group_shared_with: is deprecated" when the user is not really using this config syntax.

name: v2.8.0
body:
* **Complete support for managing groups and projects members**:
  * Add enforcing (direct) project members - groups and users, including being able to remove all direct members and keep only the members inherited from the group. Implements [#100](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/100).
  * Unify the configuration syntax for group and project level membership.

✨ **New** ✨ config syntax example:
```yaml
projects_and_groups:
  foo/*:
    # below key now includes what used to be under 
    # `group_shared_with` and `enforce_group_members` keys
    group_members:
      # there are only up to 3 direct keys below
      groups:
        another-group:
          # below key's name been changed to the name used in projects `members`
          # for groups (and the same as in the API to share a group with group)
          group_access: 30
      users:
        my-user:
          access_level: 50 # owner
      # this will enforce group-level users to be ONLY as defined above
      enforce: true

    # this will make the projects in `foo` group not contain any **direct** users or groups
    # (so it will make it contain only the ones inherited from the group `foo`)
    members:
      enforce: true
```
The 🏚 old and deprecated 🏚 syntax for a similar* config would be:
```yaml
projects_and_groups:
  foo/*:
    group_shared_with:
      groups:
        another-group:
          group_access_level: 30
    group_members:
      my-user:
        access_level: 50 # owner
    enforce_group_members: true

    # !!! * - there was no enforce project members support before v2.8.0 !!!
```
The old syntax works but will generate warnings. Support for it will be removed in one of the future major GitLabForm versions.

name: v2.7.1
body: * Speed up running for `ALL_DEFINED`, when the defined groups and projects for just a small part of all the GitLab instance's groups and projects. Additionally **always** show the number of omitted groups and projects for any reasons (no config, archived, skipped). Fixes [#285](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/285).

name: v2.7.1a2
body: * Fix the slow start on GitLab instances with a big total number of projects when requesting to process a relatively small number of groups/projects. Additionally **always** show the number of omitted groups and projects for any reasons (no config, archived, skipped) . Fixes [#285](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/285).

name: v2.7.1a1
body: * Fix the slow start on GitLab instances with a big total number of projects when requesting to process a relatively small number of groups/projects. Additionally show the number of skipped archived projects in more cases. Fixes [#285](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/285).

name: v2.7.0
body:
* **Allow processing only requested configuration sections** using a new cli argument `-os / --only-sections`.
* Minimize the number of unnecessary audit branch unprotect/protect events. Up to now every apply of the `files` section for protected branch resulted in unprotect and then (re)protect event for each protected branches and each file. Now this will only happen with the user running GitLabForm actually needs to do that, which should not happen often if you are using an admin account. Completely fixes [#178](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/178).

name: v2.6.0
body:
* **Complete support for Protected branches - access levels / users / groups allowed to push/merge/unprotect** (**GitLab Premium (paid) only**). PR [#289](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/289).
* **Add option to allow push force in protected branches**. Implements [#227](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/227).
* Fix a bug causing the app to get HTTP 502 from GitLab when protecting branches in some cases.
* Fix getting members list to include usernames of all direct members not just the first page. PR [#284](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/284).

Big thanks to the contributors of this release: [@trissanen](https://github.com/trissanen)

name: v2.5.0
body:
* **Make commit messages for file operations configurable.** Implements [#278](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/278).

Thanks to [@aleung](https://github.com/aleung) for his contribution!

name: v2.4.0
body:
* **Add wildcard support for `skip_groups` and `skip_projects`.** Implements [#275](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/275) and [#276](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/276).

Thanks to [@chris-workingmouse](https://github.com/chris-workingmouse) for his contribution!

name: v2.3.0
body:
* **Add Protected branches - users allowed to push/merge** (**GitLab Premium (paid) only**), PR [#273](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/273).
* For `ALL_DEFINED` also skip archived projects even if they are explicitly defined in the config, unless `-a` flag is added - for consistency.
* **For Contributors** Add docs for running the test themselves in a Docker container and for running GitLab in Docker using a license file, for testing paid-only features.

Thanks to [@florentio](https://github.com/florentio), [@barryib](https://github.com/barryib) and [@Pigueiras](https://github.com/Pigueiras) for their contribution!

name: v2.2.0
body:
* **Add LDAP Group Links support** (**GitLab Premium (paid) only**). Implements [#140](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/140).

* **Add project and group badges support**. Implements [#59](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/59).

* Allow 0 (no access) in Protected Tags. Fixes [#172](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/172).

* Exit on configuration missing `projects_and_groups` key. This will provide a helpful error message for typos made in this key. Fixes [#242](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/242).
* Make error messages more friendly when there is no network connection or when configuration is invalid (f.e. YAML parsing errors).
* Make the output of some processors a bit more consistent.

* Fix detecting an "empty effective config" and improve the UI related to processing groups and projects with such. Fixes [#251](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/251).

* Big refactoring that should make adding new features easier and faster. The main change is introducing a new way to implement "processors" - thanks to a generalized `MultipleEntitiesProcessor` class adding a new feature like Project Badges should is now as easy as implementing a class like `BadgesProcessor` and writing an acceptance test like `TestBadges`. Note that this new design may change in the near future and we are open to discussions and PRs to make it even better! We also plan to create a similar generalized `SingleEntityProcessor` class soon.

* Change the User Agent that the app uses when making requests to GitLab to a custom `GitLabForm/<gitlabform_version> (python-requests/<requests_version>)`.

name: v2.2.0rc2
body:
Like 2.2.0 RC1 and additionally:
* **Really** exit on configuration missing `projects_and_groups` key,
* Tests organization change, start using codecov.io to check and show tests coverage, show LGTM code grade as a badge,

name: v2.2.0rc1
body: * Fix detecting an "empty effective config" and improve the UI related to processing groups and projects with such. Fixes [#251](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/251).

name: v2.1.2
body:
* Managing project members is not incredibly slow anymore. Fixes [#240](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/240)

Thanks to [@andrewjw](https://github.com/andrewjw) (Ocado Technology) for his contribution!

name: v2.1.1
body:
* Fixed sharing group with a subgroup. Fixes [#236](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/236)
* Improved re-protecting branches after updating files in them. Fail fast if the config is invalid.
* Better Docker images:
  * Updated Alpine from 3.12 to 3.14,
  * Started to build images in ARM64 architecture (apart from x86-64),
  * Started to add tags <major_version>, <major_version>.<minor_version>. Note that Alpine-based image is the main one which gets these tags. For Debian-based images add "-buster" suffix. Implements [#173](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/173)

Thanks to [@andrewjw](https://github.com/andrewjw) (Ocado Technology) for his contribution!

name: v2.1.0
body:
* Added a feature to share groups with other groups, with optional enforcing. Implements #150.

Thanks to [@andrewjw](https://github.com/andrewjw) (Ocado Technology) for this contribution!

name: v2.0.6
body: * Fixed incorrect subgroups list when requesting to process ALL_DEFINED. Completes the fix for [#221](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/221)

name: v2.0.5
body:
* *Really* fixed issue with `unprotect_branch_new_api`. Fixes [#219](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/219)
* Fixed call to a Merge Requests Approvers API endpoint removed in GitLab 13.11.0. Fixes [#220](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/220)
* Fixed potential security issue by enabling autoescaping when loading Jinja templates. (Bandit security tool issue [B701](https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b701_jinja2_autoescape_false.html))

Thanks to [@Pigueiras](https://github.com/Pigueiras) for his contribution!

name: v2.0.4
body:
* Fixed issue with Push Rules when the the project name contains a dot. Fixes [#224](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/224)
* Fixed calling to process a single subgroup (like: `gitlabform 'group/subgroup'`). Fixes [#221](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/221)

name: v2.0.3
body: * Fixed issue with dry-run for Project Push Rules when the current config is empty (`None`). Fixes [#223](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/223)

name: v2.0.2
body: * Fixed issue with `unprotect_branch_new_api` [#219](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/219).

name: v2.0.1
body:
* Fixed issues with Jinja loader.
* Fixed calls to GitLab API that do not contain 'x-total-pages' header (gradually rolled out since [GitLab MR #23931](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/merge_requests/23931)).

Thanks to [@mkjmdski](https://github.com/mkjmdski) for his contribution!

(2.0.0post1-3 release is technically the same as 2.0.1 but was incorrectly versioned.)

name: v2.0.0
body:
✨ This a major new release that contains significant new features and bug fixes. ✨

For a complete list of them please see the [changelog](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md).

body: Please see [the appropriate changelog entry](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200-rc8).

body: Please see [the appropriate changelog entry](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200-rc6).

body: Please see [the appropriate changelog entry](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200-rc5).

name: v2.0.0rc3
body: Please see [the appropriate changelog entry](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200-rc3).

name: v2.0.0rc2
body: Please see [the appropriate changelog entry](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200-rc2).

name: v2.0.0rc1
body: Please see [the appropriate changelog entry](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#200-rc1).

name: v1.23.0
body:
* A new `--output-file`/`-o` command line switch to print the effective configurations of processed groups and projects as a YAML file. This will be useful when upgrading to v2 very soon.
* A new `--skip-archived-projects`/`-i` command line switch to stop getting errors when processing projects archived outside of GitLabForm config (#199),
* When requested to process groups / projects with an empty effective config, information about it will be printed to the output (f.e. `> (1/1) Skipping group foobar as it has empty effective config.`),
* Extended example config showing how to delete existing schedule (#194),

Thanks to @Pigueiras and @nvtkaszpir for their contributions!

name: v1.23.0rc1
body:
A pre-release with:

* A new `--skip-archived-projects`/`-i` command line switch to stop getting errors when processing projects archived outside of GitLabForm config (#199),
* Extended example config showing how to delete existing schedule (#194),
     
Thanks to @Pigueiras and @nvtkaszpir for their contributions!

(Note: this was supposed to be v1.22.0rc1...)

name: v1.21.0
body:
* Added option to remove existing MR approvers (rules) (#180),
* Improved docs (#183, #188),

Thanks to @Pigueiras, @amimas and @llamasoft for their contributions!

name: v2.0.0b2
body: Like v2.0.0b1, but with corrected dependencies, so it should actually install and work...

name: v2.0.0b1
body:
* Exit with 2 at the end if there were processing errors 
* Add color output

...and more! Please see commit messages in https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/compare/main...v2.0.0b1 for more info.

Note: this is a pre-release of a new major release. It so it is unfinished and contains some backward-incompatible changes.

name: v1.20.2
body:
* Fixed an error when trying to apply config for an archived project (note: you need to have the project explicitly configured as archived in GitLabForm config for this to work) (#157),
* Improved examples in the `config.yml` and the implementation design documentation,
* Improved local testing:
  * You can start a specific GitLab version in a Docker container now,
  * You don't need to set the `GITLAB_TOKEN` and `GITLAB_URL` variables when running tests against GitLab in a container, which makes it easy to run the tests in the IDE like IntelliJ or PyCharm,
* Bumped dependency - jinja2 from 2.11.2 to 2.11.3,

Thanks to @glensc and @vladdoster for their contributions to this version!
And to @weakcamel for his patience in waiting for a bug fix!

name: v1.20.1
body:
* Fixed an error when creating pipeline schedule without variables (#162),
* Bumped dependency - pyyaml from 5.3.1 to 5.4.1,
* Added a doc about [how to run automatically for new projects](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/main/docs/AUTOMATE_FOR_NEW_PROJECTS.md),
* Added a project logo! 🎉

Thanks to @trzeciakp and @grzesuav for their contributions!

name: v1.20.0
body:
* Removed the support for Python 3.5 which reached EOL on 13 Sep 2020 and `pip` will stop working with it at the end of January 2021. GitLabForm now "officially" supports Python 3.6-3.8 and "unofficially" should work on Python 3.9.
* Completed the migration of this project CI from Travis CI to GitHub Actions (#156),
* Renamed the "master" branch of the project to "main", along with all the "master" references in the code and docs (#159).

name: v1.19.0
body:
* Added support for `code_owner_approval_required` flag for protected branches (**GitLab EE only**) (#154)
* Fixed a pipelines_schedules bug - `Unexpected return code 202 on delete` (#148)

(Note: this release has been pushed only to PyPI, NOT to the DockerHub because the migration of this project CI from Travis to GitHub Actions was not complete at the moment of release. The next final version should be released as both PyPI package and DockerHub images.)

name: v1.19.0rc1
body:
* Added support for `code_owner_approval_required` flag for protected branches (**GitLab EE only**) (#154)

(Note that this is a pre-release, pushed only to PyPI, without Docker build yet. The above features will be released as a standard release soon, after we add tests to #154 and perform the migration of the security, integration tests and Docker builds to GitHub Actions.)

name: v1.18.4
body:
With #46 implemented.

Thanks to @jcovington16 for this contribution!

(This is not really a new release but a one from Dec 16 2020 that we forgot to describe back then.)

name: v1.18.3.2
body:
With #147 fixed.

Thanks to @grzesuav for reporting and cooperation on fixing the issue!

P.S. Do not use Docker images tagged as v1.18.3.1 - they have been incorrectly built and in fact contain v1.18.0 of the app. We have removed them from Dockerhub but they may still remain on your machines. Sorry for the inconvenience!

name: v1.18.2
body:
New features:
* You can now add container registry expiration policy (#114),
* Save for project settings using JSON payload has been improved.

Changes for contributors:
* Contributing guidelines have been updated with information about versioning and release process (see [the docs](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#releases)),
* README view for PyPI has been improved by providing permalinks.

Thanks to @glensc for his contributions!

name: v1.18.0
body:
New features:
* You can now configure Pipeline schedules (implements #66),
* Info about the changes that will be applied will be provided for some sections, if you enable the verbose (`-v`) or debug (`-d`) mode together with noop/dry run (`-n`),

Changes for contributors:
* A big refactoring has made the code modularized and easier to add new features (see [the docs](https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/blob/master/IMPLEMENTATION_DESIGN.md#how-tos)),
* The code is now formatted with [Black](https://github.com/psf/black),

Big thanks 🙏 to @kowpatryk , the author of almost ALL of the changes in this release (PRs #129 & #130)! 👏 🎉

Additional thanks to @akaRem who has provided the code that has been used for implementing the diffing feature (PR #44).

name: v1.17.0.1
body:
* Customizable timeout for HTTP requests to GitLab (#124) added
* Docker images updated (Alpine 3.10->3.12, Python 3.7->3.8)

Thanks to @grzesuav for his contributions!

name: v1.16.0
body:
With added possibility to delete secret variables on project and group levels (#110). Thanks to @ss7548 for the contribution!

Additionally the dependencies have been updated and app version and update check on each run has been added (use `-V` to just print the version and exit or `-k` to prevent the update check that is now being done on each run).

(Note: this is technically the same code as in v.1.15.4.1 which was an invalid version as we should have upticked the minor version as new features have been added in it.)

name: v1.15.3
body: With #107 fixed: you can now change secret variable's (both project-level and group-level) `protected` and `masked` parameters without changing the variable's value. Thanks to @ss7548 for reporting the issue and helping in providing the fix!

name: v1.15.2
body: With #108 fixed and some minor improvements.

name: v1.15.1
body: With #96 fixed: now managing files works for branches protected using the new Protected branches API. Thanks to @KrystianOcado for the contribution!

name: v1.15.0
body: With #27 fixed: you can now configure branch protection in a more granular way (using Protected branches API). Thanks to @rbartuzel for the contribution!

name: v1.14.0
body: With Merge Request Approvals API implementation without limitations as in v1.12.0 (see #68 for more info). Thanks to @weakcamel for reporting the issue and providing feedback and support during the (long) work on the fix!

name: v1.13.5
body: With Services management working without MANY issues that we had with this feature before, including #69 and #70 . Thanks to @Dridge for reporting them and to Vincent Bisserié for the help in finding the root cause!

name: v1.13.3
body: With #85 fixed: now you can actually create new Push Rules, not only edit existing ones. Thanks to @grzesuav  for the contribution!

name: v1.13.2
body: With full Group Membership management - not only adding users and changing their access level, but also removing them, with proper support various cases related to group having to have at least 1 Owner (GitLab requirement).

name: v1.12.0
body: With implementation of the Merge Request Approvals API that makes setting MR approvers possible again, althougth with a limitation to up to 1 user and 1 group as approvers. See #68 for more info and https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/issues/68#issuecomment-581003703 specifically for suggestion how to work around the limitation.

name: v1.11.0
body: With adding/changing access level of group members (which provides a workaround for #68).

name: v1.10.0
body: With managing files in all protected branches (fixes #14).

name: v1.9.0
body: With group settings management (fixes #58 and part of #6) and project archive/unarchive feature.

name: v1.8.0
body: With full subgroups support.

name: v1.7.0
body: With option to ignore SSL erros. Thanks to @akaRem for the code!

name: v1.6.0
body: With group-level secret variables support. Thanks to @SilverXXX for the contribution!

name: Packaging with docker
body: Hey! We are happy to announce that since today you can use gitlabform as a docker image egnyte/gitlabform. :)

name: v1.5.0
body: With subgroups support for setting Merge Requests approvers. Thanks to @therealgambo for inspiration!

name: v1.4.1
body: With app crashing on missing config sections fixed (https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/47). Thanks to @akaRem for this contribution!

name: v1.4.0
body: With project members management (users and groups) (https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/40) and some bugs fixed (https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/42 , https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/43 , https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/45). Thanks to @therealgambo and @akaRem for their contributions!

name: v1.3.0
body: With Protected Tags support (https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/39). Thanks to @therealgambo for this contribution!

name: v1.2.0
body: With Jinja2 templates support (https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/36). Thanks to @mkjmdski for this contribution!

name: v1.1.0
body: With (Project) Push Rules support (#38 ). Thanks to @icy for this contribution!

name: v1.0.6
body: This release add functionality to create branch.

name: v1.0.4
body: Added Pipelines API support (not used by cli `gitlabform` yet).

Fixes #30 

This release fixes problems with finding branches .

name: v1.0.0
body:
This version switches from using GitLab API v3 to v4 to make it compatible with GitLab 11+.

Note that this change will most probably require an update of your `config.yml` as GitLabForm takes some parameter names from this file directly and they have changed in API v4. See changes in `config.yml` in this diff for a few examples: https://github.com/egnyte/gitlabform/pull/28/files 

This version should also be a lot faster as we reduced the number of API calls by about 50% (!) by using "group/project" as a parameter wherever possible  instead of querying for project id before each call that actually does something first. (Yes, I know that we could have cached that project id from the start :P but this was not trivial under current app design.)
With support for configuring project-level Merge Requests approval settings and approvers list (#26).

With support for simple templating - only `{{ group }}` and `{{ project }}` are supported
for now, no escaping. Fixes #15 .
With #9, #17 and #18 fixed. No new features really, so perhaps this should rather be still v0.20.x but it's too late now. ;)
Allow setting file contents from external files, not only embedded in the `config.yml` (#5). See updated `config.yaml` for examples.
With fixed a bug that made run with `ALL` fail on first project that has no config.

Now we have 3 configuration levels: common (new!), group and project. And you can run `gitlabform` with all projects your access token allows. This way it's possible to configure things for all projects in your GitLab instance. See updated `config.yaml` for examples.

**Note:** the cli api has changed - `ALL` now means all projects you have access to, while `ALL_DEFINED` means, well, all projects and groups defined in the config. This is safe though because if you only upgrade gitlabform without updating the config you will not have the new `common_config:` key and no new projects will be configured.

name: v0.18.0
body:
With added possibility to make selected file changes not trigger CI builds
(disabled by default, set `skip_ci` to `true` to enable it, see example `config.yml`)
and some minor fixes.
With fixed looking for config in `~/.gitlabform/config.yml` when used as a library
With fixed processing exception when response code is not in a list

With possibility to skip configuration sections per project (a workaround for #2) and unified
skipping using "skip" keyword (changed from "ignore" used up to this point for single files).
See skip-related comments in example `config.yml`.
